title: Demon (attribute)

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Demon attribute is a combat attribute that provides weaknesses to demonbane weapons.

content:
This article is about the demon monster type. For the race, see Demon.

The Demon attribute is a combat attribute that provides weaknesses to demonbane weapons.

Contents

  • 1 Effects
  • 2 List of monsters
  • 3 Excluded monsters
  • 4 Changes

Effects[edit | edit source]

  • Silverlight increases the player's maximum hit up to the level of a rune longsword.
  • Darklight increases the player's maximum hit up to the level of a dragon longsword and has a special attack, Weaken, that reduces a demon's Attack, Strength, and Defence by 10% of the monster's maximum level on a successful hit.
  • Arclight increases the player's accuracy and damage by 70% when charged with ancient shards. Arclight retains the special attack Weaken from its predecessor, Darklight.
  • Holy water has increased effectiveness against the monster.
  • Demonbane spells can be cast against demons, and are more effective if under the effects of the Mark of Darkness spell.
  • Ward of Arceuus grants 10% damage reduction against their attacks, including K'ril Tsutsaroth's special attack.

Excluded monsters[edit | edit source]

Despite being demons in RuneScape lore, the following monsters do not have the demon attribute and are therefore not considered demons for combat purposes:

  • Nightmare Zone
    • Bouncer
    • Jungle Demon
  • Skeletal Hellhounds
    • Skeleton Hellhound (Vet'ion)
    • Greater Skeleton Hellhound
  • Revenants
    • Revenant imp
    • Revenant hellhound
    • Revenant pyrefiend
    • Revenant demon

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
17 March 2021
(update)

Several monsters previously not classified as demons were tagged as demonic, allowing demonbane weapons to work on them.

  • Xerician
rawContent:
{{otheruses|the demon monster type|the race|Demon}}
The '''Demon''' [[monster attribute|attribute]] is a combat attribute that provides weaknesses to [[demonbane weapons]]. 

==Effects==
* [[Silverlight]] increases the player's maximum hit up to the level of a [[rune longsword]].
* [[Darklight]] increases the player's maximum hit up to the level of a [[dragon longsword]] and has a [[special attack]], ''Weaken'', that reduces a demon's [[Attack]], [[Strength]], and [[Defence]] by 10% of the monster's maximum level on a successful hit.
* [[Arclight]] increases the player's accuracy and damage by 70% when charged with [[ancient shard]]s. Arclight retains the special attack ''Weaken'' from its predecessor, Darklight.
* [[Holy water]] has increased effectiveness against the monster.
* [[Demonbane spells]] can be cast against demons, and are more effective if under the effects of the [[Mark of Darkness]] spell.
* [[Ward of Arceuus]] grants 10% damage reduction against their attacks, including [[K'ril Tsutsaroth]]'s special attack.

==List of monsters==
{{Bestiarytable|fromletter=A|toletter=Z|levelselect=no|levelsort=no|attribute=demon}}

==Excluded monsters==
Despite being demons in RuneScape lore, the following monsters do not have the demon attribute and are therefore not considered demons for combat purposes:

* [[Nightmare Zone]]
** [[Bouncer]]
** [[Jungle Demon]]
* Skeletal Hellhounds
** [[Skeleton Hellhound (Vet'ion)]]
** [[Greater Skeleton Hellhound]]
* Revenants
** [[Revenant imp]]
** [[Revenant hellhound]]
** [[Revenant pyrefiend]]
** [[Revenant demon]]

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 17 March 2021
|update = Shooting Stars
|change = Several monsters previously not classified as demons were tagged as demonic, allowing demonbane weapons to work on them.
}}
